Killing Floor is the most entertaining horror-shooter I've ever played. It has a good variety of levels and enemies to kill, fun weapons that feel badass to use, and more Workshop mods than you can shake a stick at! Between this and the Left 4 Dead series, pick this if you want a more arcade Call of Duty Zombies type game, or if you just want to watch heads explode. Trust me, its fun as hell!

PROS:

1. Action-Packed.
2. Decent Graphics.
3. Skins/Weapons.
4. Challenging.
5. Matchmaking does not have too much problems.
6. Multiplayer/Co-Op (Could play with friends)

CONS:

1. No Crosshair (That is just me)
2. Do not like the speed of how humans run/walk.
3. Sometimes glitchy, zombie is somewhere that you cannot hunt for, making it frustrating and ending up leaving the server.
4. Workshop can be a bit annoying, and especially confusing.
5. Update more things.
6. Lastly, when you add servers to your favorites, and you want to play that particular server. Which to me, is really annoying and frustrating.

Overall, I do recommend the game in the end, it is a good game to shoot some zombies and enjoy your time and have fun with your friends. Don't forget, there is skin camos and skins that look awesome and sweet. Although, downloading or trying to get anything from Killing Floors workshop, can be extremely confusing and annoying. It is multiplayer, you can have fun and I am really excited and looking forward to Killing Floor 2. Good job Killing Floor! You've done a great job! Keep up the great work!

Ein Survival Coop mit Zombies und Freaks als unheilige Gegnerschaft, bestenfalls mit viel "blood & gore"!
Levelbare Perks bringen Würze, wie auch abwechselungsreiche Maps, Waffen und die gute Verträglichkeit mit Mods, Mapping und Modelling.
Man kann zwar Solo spielen, aber erst mit mehreren beginnt die Gaudi!
Je nach Schwierigkeitsgrad ist das Zusammenspiel mit den verschiedenen Perk(klassen) pficht.
Töten, heilen usw. bringen Geld ein, das nach jeder Runde (meist 4-10) bei der netten Händlerin gegen Gewehre, Äxte, Rohrbombe, Flammenwerfer, Heilpistolen oder Kettensäge und Katana eingetauscht werden kann.
Die Karten reichen von Sümpfen, Biolaboren, bis zur Innenstadt Londons, die Spielvarianten sind u.A. Objective (Aufgaben zusammen lösen), Survival/ KillingFloor (einfach überleben/töten), oder auch (eher seltener) eine Art Verteidigung (kostenloser ToyBox-Mod), sowie GunGame.
Wirklich spassig, besonders wenn man auf "erwachsene Weise" metzeln kann (Google o.A. helfen).
Die DLCs sind  teils zu teuer, aber man brauch ja nicht zwingen alle (bzw. brauchen ist da ohnehin relativ, denn auch ohne DLCs fehlen nur unwesentliche (teils nur buntere) Waffen oder Spielerskins, dies kann aber mit Servern, die custom Skins erlauben begegnet werden.

Einzig teils puberäre Trollblagen (die ohnehin noch nicht diesen Titel spielen dürften) nerven teils mit Voice oder Soundchat und dem Verhalten von Kamaradenschweinen. Zumindest den akustischen Terror kann man damit bekämpfen, dass beides deaktiviert, bzw. dezidiert ignoriert werden kann.

Fazit: Sowohl kurzweilig, als auch länger ein Heidenspass, von mir 85/100 Punkten!
Kaufen & spielen, ob mit oder ohne Reduzierung!

*edit*
Leider besteht ein Teil der ameikanischen Community aus alles andere als sozialen Menschen, was nicht auf das ingame bezogen werden sollt.
bullets, naked men and a whole lotta blood. 10/10 would shoot again

- Un bon défouloir ? oui
- Gore ? très gore
- Sympa avec des joueurs et fun avec des amis ? assurément mais ennuyeux seul
- Beau Graphiquement ? non, puisqu'il s'agit de l'Unreal Engine 2,5 mais au moins ça tourne sur des configs pas très récentes
- Bon rapport Qualité / prix ? 17,99 ça reste un peu cher selon moi, mais il y a assez souvent des promos et là pour moins de 5euros ça en vaut vraiment le coup !
- La bande son c'est comment ? C'est METAL ! plus sérieusement entre cris des monstres en rognes et VF ridicule au point de faire apparaître un sourire sur la plupart des visages des joueurs, c'est proche de potable
- Y'a t'il un suivi des développeurs ? Workshop + Quelques MàJ et peut être un peu beaucoup de DLCs, nan trop de DLCs donc oui il y a un certain suivi, on verra si ce sera pareil quand le 2 sera sorti...
- Est ce qu'il est dur ? tout dépend de la difficulté et du niveau de vos coéquipiers mais une fois encerclé par une horde d'ennemis, ça devient un sacré challenge
- Il y a un système de classe c'est ça ? tout juste Auguste, et tout le monde y trouve son compte, le bourrin, le médecin, le pyromane...
- Beaucoup de modes de jeux ? non pas vraiment, après suffit de chercher un serveur dédicacé pour trouver un peu de tout et n'importe quoi
Bref au moment où je poste mon avis il est en promo, profitez en

This is just how zombie games were meant to be played.

Killing Floor is a zombie survival multiplayer where players can either work together or try that hand at being a Lone Wolf but everyone's goal is to survive the waves of the dead. To start Killing Floor has a massive selectment of maps either Developer made or even Community made. You will never play every single map that Killing Floor has to offer but this means that you will never get tired of playing the same stage over and over. As a player of a 6 or less team you can choose from various perks that will define how you play the game, like being a sharpshooter, medic, or demolitionist. Each of these perks can be leveled up to 6 increasing how much damage is done when using said perk or how much of a discount on that perks weapons when shopping at the trader. Using your teams unique skills and strategy you will generally try and find an area in the map that is the most defendable whether that's because your back is to a wall or that you can weld doors in that section. Then you will have to fight the waves of the dead that each have their own specific talents as well, some will scream dealing damage directly to health and some will brandish chainsaws going into a rage and charging you as soon as you try to damage them. At the end of every game you will fight the Patriarch or in gamer terms "the boss". Weilding a minigun/rocket launcher in one had and using his talons on the other he is one big S.O.B. that you will want everyone on the team together to take down. 

In summary, If you can appreciate the zombie survival genre then Killing Floor is a must buy that you will never grow tired of. With lots of customisable options such as your character, perk, and map you'll always find a different playing experience everytime you head to a new stage.

Surprisingly-complex game with a simple premise: make ugly things go dead with your friends. AI and maps have some funny exploits but rather than cheapen the experience, they make the game feel richer. And you'll still need proper communication with your team to make the mission run smoothly. If you like grindy shooter games but also like feeling satisfied after every grind session, get Killing Floor.

Note that the movement and aiming can feel very tank-ish if you're coming from other shooters. My biggest issue is probably the matchmaking and lobbies; it can take forever to connect to a server, and trying to join friends often requires you to manually paste the server IP into the matchmaking interface. Game also has a tendency to crash when you alt + tab out.

This is one of the most funny but deep FPS you can get at an extremely low prices, with regular updates and bug fixes. Tripwire is indeedly a superb company cause they keep suporting the game. The game is integrated with workshopr whihc means you can have HUNDREDS of FREE MAPS AND MODS unlikely that other shitty games like battleshit and and COD.

The perk systems is easy to use but complex, this is not a cowodudy bullshit where you just get in the MP and shoot like an ape to whatever, in killing floor you HAVE to know the strenghts and weaknesses fo the perks and the ZEDS (aka zombies if you preffer it).

If you get in to the game as commando trying to exhange bullents with a scrake or a fleshpond for sure will die, and not just that you potentially will screw your team. KF encourages 100% like non other game a real teamwork in a perfect way.

But do not get me wrong, is not a "hard" FPS, have a really slighty high knwoledge curve, and read the wiki is a MUST DO. The multiplayes is plenty of players all the time. I freaking hate the MP FPS, but this one is by far THE BEST handsdown. 

In resume: a game that cost you around 5 USD, that gives you HUNDREDS of FREE MAPS, MODS and constant support from tripwire, seasson events like the halloween and christmas event makes KF the best multiplayer online coop FPS right now, you cannot have a better game at this  price point which gives you so many hours of fun.

(Sorry for my grammar english is not my native language)
